instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Backlight F7700
threads.message:
Guys,
I replaced <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> - <RESISTOR>R7715</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7731</RESISTOR> i get backlight for 5 seconds, but, the fuse F7700 blew up twice now.

F7700 Pin1: 8.57V
Short to ground pin 3 - 164k[COLOR=#666666][FONT=arial]‎Ω[/FONT][/COLOR]

Any idea what happen?

Thank u

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Backlight F7700
threads.message: Inspect display connector carefully, try whit another known good displayt assembly......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Backlight F7700
threads.message:
[USER="36"]aprendiz[/USER] You are right. The lvds cable pin 2 and 3 looks really bad. I will replace.
Thank you for your advice.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Backlight F7700
threads.message: If the cable is bad the connector on the board must also be replaced!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B - Backlight F7700
